remarks: Analog of modular law ~ atmod1i2 that holds in any OML. (Contributed by NM, 6-Dec-2013.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
omlmod.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
omlmod.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
omlmod.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
omlmod.m $e |- ./\ = ( meet ` K ) $.
omlmod.c $e |- C = ( cm ` K ) $.
omlmod1i2N $p |- ( ( K e. OML /\ ( X e. B /\ Y e. B /\ Z e. B ) /\ ( X .<_ Z /\ Y C Z ) ) -> ( X .\/ ( Y ./\ Z ) ) = ( ( X .\/ Y ) ./\ Z ) ) $.
